Description.Name: ...what's that knock knock knocking
Description.Details: You awaken to an unusual knocking sound. It is quite at odds to the even pulsing rhythm coming from the jumpship's Kearny-Fuchida drive that the Argo is docked to as it charges in preparation for the next jump. You look at your chronograph, the digits showing it is after midnight in the standard sleep cycle. You reach over to your nightstand and key in the intercom code for Engineering. Click... Click... A voice answers, "Engineering." You clear your throat, "This is Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, What's going on down there? What the hell is that knocking noise?" The ensign nervously answers, "Uh, Commander, Sir, uh, we don't know yet what is causing it. Dr Murad has gone to Navigation to investigate it further." "Thank you, ensign," you respond as you disconnect the call. You punch in the code for Naviagtion. Click... Click... A voice answers, "Navigation." You do not even identify yourself, "Put Dr Murad on the line." Seconds later Dr Murad answers, "I presume the knocking noise woke you, Commander?" You let out a short laugh, "What in blazes is going on up there? Do I need to come to the bridge?" Dr Murad calmly responds, "I don't thinks so Commander. I've narrowed it down to something in Navigation, but am not 100% sure of the cause yet."

Description.Name: Failing FuCapacitor
Description.Details: "Well, you are the Periphery's foremost expert on ancient DropShips. If anyone can solve this problem," you say to Dr. Murad over the intercom, "it is you." Dr Murad responds, "I know the noise is coming from something in Navigation, There are too many other sounds to pinpoint the origin and I just cannot put my finger on it. If I don't find the cause, we won't be getting much sleep Commander." A louder bang resonates from over by the Kerby-FuCheetah Console. Dr Murad goes to investigate, "Oh, that's interesting!" "Did you find out the cause?" you ask. Dr Murad sounds surprised, "Possibly Commander. I suspect it is coming from our newly installed Console. I've had a quick inspection of the Console, and it appears we may have a failing Fu Capacitor. I've jiggled it and the noise has stopped for now." You yawn loudly, "Let one of the ensigns on night shift keep an eye on it. Go back to bed and will deal with it as needed.."

Description.Name: No Effect
Description.Details: "If the Periphery's foremost expert on ancient DropShips can't solve this problem," you say to Dr. Murad over the intercom, "then the problem cannot be solved. We need you fresh and of a clear mind, so please do not spend too much time tracking this down." Dr Murad responds, "I know the noise is coming from something in Navigation, There are too many other sounds to pinpoint the origin and I just cannot put my finger on it. If I don't find the cause, we won't be getting much sleep Commander." Suddenly, the knocking noise stops. "Did you find out the cause?" you ask. Dr Murad sounds surprised, "No Commander, I have no more insight than I did when it started." You yawn loudly, "Let one of the ensigns on night shift dig into it. Go back to bed and if it happens again we can deal with it in the morning."
